name: propiophenone, 3,3-diphenyl-
Reason: The compound propiophenone, 3,3-diphenyl- has a high melting point due to its molecular structure. The presence of two phenyl groups as the base unit, with a typical melting point of around 41°C, is significantly altered by the addition of other functional groups and structural features. The aromatic ring itself contributes to rigidity and planarity, which can increase the melting point. Each phenyl group adds to the melting point due to increased hydrogen bonding capability. The presence of a conjugated double bond and an aromatic-like structure within the macrocycle can also contribute to a higher melting point.
